name: Mercury
longDescription: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, experiencing extreme temperature fluctuations. It has almost no atmosphere.

name: Venus
longDescription: Venus is known for its dense atmosphere and extremely high surface temperatures. It is the hottest planet in the Solar System, with no liquid water on its surface.

name: Earth
longDescription: Earth is the only known planet to support life, with its oceans, landmasses, and atmosphere. It is the third planet from the Sun, with a unique climate and water cycle.

name: Mars
longDescription: Mars appears red due to iron oxide on its surface. Evidence suggests it once had water, and it is currently being studied by unmanned exploration missions.

name: Jupiter
shortDescription: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system.
longDescription: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System, primarily composed of hydrogen and helium. It is known for its Great Red Spot, a storm larger than Earth.

name: Saturn
longDescription: Saturn is known for its extensive and prominent ring system. Like Jupiter, it is a gas giant, primarily made of hydrogen and helium. Its rings are composed of ice and rock.

name: Uranus
longDescription: Uranus is unique for its tilted axis. Its blue-green color comes from methane in its atmosphere. It is classified as an ice giant.

name: Neptune
longDescription: Neptune is the outermost planet in the Solar System, known for its violent winds. Its atmosphere contains methane, giving it a blue appearance.

name: Pluto
longDescription: Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006. Its surface is made of ice and rock, and it resides in the Kuiper Belt of the Solar System.
